tool.name: tool_1

param.name: VAL_INPUT
param.dialogReference:
Input for Mean over Catchment

Grid, input, optional

optional

param.name: FLOW_UNIT
param.dialogReference:
Flow Accumulation Unit

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] number of cells

[1] cell area

Default: 1

param.name: FLOW_LENGTH
param.dialogReference:
Flow Path Length

Grid, output, optional

optional

average distance that a cell's accumulated flow travelled

param.name: WEIGHT_LOSS
param.dialogReference:
Loss through Negative Weights

Grid, output, optional

optional

when using weights without support for negative flow: output of the absolute amount of negative flow that occurred

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Method

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] Deterministic 8

[1] Rho 8

[2] Deterministic Infinity

[3] Multiple Flow Direction

Default: 3

param.name: CONVERGENCE
param.dialogReference:
Convergence

Floating point

Minimum: 0.000000

Default: 1.100000

Convergence factor for Multiple Flow Direction Algorithm (Freeman 1991)

param.name: MFD_CONTOUR
param.dialogReference:
Contour Length

Boolean

Default: 0

Include (pseudo) contour length as additional weighting factor in multiple flow direction routing, reduces flow to diagonal neighbour cells by a factor of 0.71 (s. Quinn et al. 1991 for details).

param.name: NO_NEGATIVES
param.dialogReference:
Prevent Negative Flow Accumulation

Boolean

Default: 1

when using weights: do not transport negative flow, set it to zero instead; useful e.g. when accumulating measures of water balance.

tool.summary:
Recursive upward processing of cells for calculation of flow accumulation and related parameters. This set of algorithms processes recursively all upwards connected cells until each cell of the DEM has been processed. Flow routing methods provided by this tool:
  • Deterministic 8 (aka D8, O'Callaghan & Mark 1984)
  • Rho 8 (Fairfield & Leymarie 1991)
  • Multiple Flow Direction (Freeman 1991, Quinn et al. 1991)
  • Deterministic Infinity (Tarboton 1997)
